title: Chicago Connection Clinic Megathread [Closed]
body:
***Thank you everyone for taking the time to respond to this thread!  While we are closing this thread for comments, we are still hard at work behind the scenes with ISPs to make sure that connection paths are as efficient as possible as well as peering with new ISPs.***  

***For the latest updates and information regarding ISPs, check out this [Knowledge Base Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204246204-NA-Server-Roadmap#h1).***

------------------------------------------------

***ISP Watchlist*** -- ISPs we are currently investigating from form submissions/posts:

* Verizon
* [Shaw](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/PZclbVoE-chicago-connection-clinic-megathread?comment=0353)
* Suddenlink (9/1 - For players near Ashburn, VA, we've created a peering session there which should help reduce ping!)
* CableOne
* Telus
* Windstream (9/1 -- Players shouldn't be routed to Seattle first, before going to Chicago, which should also drop ping)
* CenturyLink (added 8/27)
* Cox

["I wanna help get this problem fixed, what can I do?"](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/PZclbVoE-chicago-connection-clinic-megathread?show=nested&comment=035a)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

> #Change Log *(we’ll update this Change Log between now and August 30th, 23:59 PDT, so check back for updates!)* 

***September 3 @ 14:18 PDT:*** After working back and forth with Shaw, they removed some internal configurations that were routing players away from Chicago.  Once fixed, we saw healthier connections that were routed directly to Chicago.

***September 1 @ 15:22 PDT:*** We received several reports of Heavenlink users having extremely bad ping.  We have reached out to them to get a contact there, and will provide further updates once we hear back from them.

***September 1 @ 14:37 PDT:*** We set up a peering session in Ashburn VA for Suddenlink users.  Players in that area should see a reduction in their ping!

***September 1 @ 13:49 PDT:*** Windstream update!  We worked with their engineers and made changes that should prevent players from being routed to Seattle first, then to Chicago.  This should resolve a lot of ping issues, but [submit your information](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs) if you are still seeing very bad ping!

***September 1 @ 13:03 PDT:*** Here is the latest on Shaw -- We have contacted the Network Engineers in Shaw to respond back to us and ensure that routing paths through our peering are as efficient as possible.  We'll update everyone as soon as we learn more.  In the meantime and in order to help us out with talking to Shaw, make sure to continue to [submit logs](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs) if you are seeing issues!

***September 1 @ 11:44 PDT:*** Identified routing issues in Texas for Charter users.  We re-jiggered some routing, which should improve overall ping for players there!

***September 1 @ 10:19 PDT:*** We reached out to Pavlov, and successfully set up peering in both Los Angeles and Dallas.  Users around these areas should see an improvement in ping!  If you are still experiencing issues, make sure to [submit your logs](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs)!

--------------------------------------------------------

***August 31 @ 17:54 PDT:*** From investigating reports of Comcast users, we might have found an issue between them and their ISP backbone.  We have contacted Comcast to see if this is intended, and whether we can resolve these issues. If you are still seeing issues with Comcast, make sure to [submit a log ](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs)so we can look into it further!

***August 31 @ 15:17 PDT:*** We identified issues with Xplornet, and was able to contact them to set up peering with Chicago.  These changes should hopefully go into effect very soon!

***August 31 @ 10:22 PDT:*** There is some oddness between Shentel and Airwave providing inefficient paths. We are reaching out to both ISPs to get a point of contact.  That way, we can work with them and hopefully peer with them around Ashburn, VA.

------------------------------------------------------------

***August 30 @ 14:32 PDT:*** As peak traffic hours approach, we're about to put a capital "S" on "Stress test". If you see a dramatic shift in your connection this evening, please [submit a log](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs). This helps us track down when ISPs shift peak traffic and to where!

***August 30 @ 13:30 PDT:*** Shaw update: while we had solved some initial routing issues, it looks like some Shaw user connections are still having problems. We have a contact with them and are reaching out first thing Monday morning.

---------------------------------------------------------------

***August 28 @ 13:42 PDT:*** We have resolved most routing issues with Sasktel.  Most to all players should be connecting to the nearest PoP.  Make sure to submit your information in the [Log Gathering Tool](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs) if you still are being routed weirdly!

***August 28 @ 12:44 PDT:*** Cox users in the Midwest/South should see an improvement in their connections as peering has come online in these areas.  We are still working with Cox to set-up peering for players further west.  We'll update everyone once we have new info!

***August 28 @ 11:20 PDT:*** Since last night, we have worked with Shaw to establish peering in both Seattle, as well as in Chicago.  Players using Shaw should connect to the nearest PoP, rather than everyone being routed to Seattle first. There may be edge cases, so make sure to submit us your information with the [Log Gathering Tool](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs)!

---------------------------------------------------------------

***August 27 @ 22:35 PDT:*** Unfortunately, the changes to Shaw weren't too effective.  We have since disabled peering with them and players will be using the public internet to get to Chicago, which should hopefully provide a better experience than on the current peering path.  While we continue to work with Shaw, make sure to [contact them directly](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/PZclbVoE-chicago-connection-clinic-megathread?show=nested&comment=035a) so we can work together to get this resolved!

***August 27 @ 18:51 PDT:*** We have made some change Shaw, that should improve routing.  Make sure to test out and reply back in this thread if our changes have or haven't improved your ping!

***August 27 @ 18:27 PDT:*** We are currently in discussion with CenturyLink to see if we can help resolve routing issues.  In order to help this process, make sure to [contact them directly](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/PZclbVoE-chicago-connection-clinic-megathread?show=nested&comment=035a) and provide them your information!

***August 27 @ 13:10 PDT:*** We've experienced some delays with Shaw on creating more efficient routing paths.  We may [disable peering](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/PZclbVoE-chicago-connection-clinic-megathread?comment=0353) with them before we go into peak hours for NA to give a better experience for players.  We continue to suggest contacting them directly, and [asking them to help us resolve these issues](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/PZclbVoE-chicago-connection-clinic-megathread?show=nested&comment=035a)!

***August 27 @ 12:13 PDT:*** For Sasktel users, we have established peering locations closer to the Chicago Servers, which should improve ping.  Give us some feedback and let us know if it has or hasn't improved at all!

***August 27 @ 10:51 PDT:*** Suddenlink users near Toronto should expect less ping and a more stable connection due to us properly peering there.  We are still working with Suddenlink to resolve issues elsewhere!

***August 27 @ 9:27 PDT:*** We have resolved the hardware issue for Comcast users in Colorado.  Players there should see an improvement in their ping!

------------------------------------------------------------------

***August 26 @ 17:30 PDT:*** We have been working with Shaw to resolve the routing issues, and we should have a resolution soon.  Find more detailed information [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/PZclbVoE-chicago-connection-clinic-megathread?comment=0353).

***August 26 @ 16:53 PDT:*** We have found an issue causing problems for players using CableOne.  We are working with ISP backbones in order to get this fixed.

***August 26 @ 15:26 PDT:*** We have reached out to Suddenlink in order to peer, and are waiting to hear back.  If you would like Suddenlink to peer with us, make sure to contact and ask them directly! If your not sure what to say, check out [this post](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/PZclbVoE-chicago-connection-clinic-megathread?show=nested&comment=035a)!

***August 26 @ 13:44 PDT:*** For Comcast users in Colorado, we are working on resolving a hardware issue there that should improve your ping.  This should be completed soon! 

***August 26 @ 12:37 PDT:*** We believe we have identified an issue with Telus, where connections are being routed to Seattle first instead of taking the most efficient path to Chicago.  We are currently investigating with Telus on how we can get this resolved ASAP.

***August 26 @ 10:00 PDT:*** If you're experiencing packet loss and/or high latency from an ISP not currently peered with us, make sure to contact them directly as there may be issues with ISP backbones.

--------------------------------------------------------------

***August 25 @ 17:00 PDT: ***We're investigating issues with Windstream.  Latest information can be found in this [post](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/PZclbVoE-chicago-connection-clinic-megathread?show=nested&comment=00310006).

***August 25 @ 12:10 PDT:*** Chicago migration is COMPLETE!

***August 25 @ 10:00 PDT:*** We have worked with Verizon and we believe we have identified the root cause and performed some changes that should resolve most of these packet loss issues.  Thanks to everyone who sent us logs and responded to this thread! Let us know if you are still seeing these issues!


***August 25 @ 05:00 PDT:*** Chicago migration has started!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hey everyone!

The Chicago servers are now live!  We know that with the relocation, most connection paths will have changed and, in some cases, may be routed inefficiently. We’ve been preparing for this on our end for a while now, and most should be properly routed, but we want to work with you guys to identify and squash any remaining issues.

**If you’re experiencing higher ping than [we’ve estimated](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/205238344-NA-Server-Move-FAQ#h1)  make sure to fill out our [Chicago Log Gathering Tool](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs).**  


***Do not post the results in this thread!  It contains sensitive information about your connection info!***

Also, make sure to check whether we’ve [peered with your ISP](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204246204-NA-Server-Roadmap#h3).  If we haven’t peered with your ISP yet, feel free to reach out to them and ask them to peer with us!

> ***Note:*** Some of the more high-profile ISP names are missing from that list. We’re currently installing our connections with **Cox, AT&T, and Verizon,** and expect to have peering fully up and running with all three of them within a few weeks. If you’re playing League on one of these ISPs, your connection post-Chicago move may not be on the most efficiently-routed path until that work completes. We’ll keep this discussion updated as these ISPs come online.

Our tech experts will review every one of the forms you guys submit to identify any problems and work to resolve them ASAP. Once we have info to share, we’ll update the top of this thread with any resolutions.  Also, we’ll keep an eye out for any questions in this thread and respond when we can, but the best way to have us look at your connection is by using the **[Chicago Log Gathering Tool!](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs)**

The following tech experts are here to help: 

Steeb
Morgageddon
dArtagnan
Digital Ram
Riot WizardOTL
Riot Foro
Korensky
Riot Laslow
Riot R3lick

replies.body:
location: Kentucky.
ISP: Windstream 

Old ping: 100-110 
New ping: 110-120

How does this make sense?

You have the same location, ISP, and issue I'm having. I posted the network diagnostic result in my comment in this thread for any RIOT that sees it.

Edit: Here is my information since this is now at the top.

ISP: Windstream
Old ping: 125-135
New ping: 120-165+
Location: Northern Kentucky (325 miles from Chicago) (2000 miles closer to the data center)
Distance from old server: 2200 miles

The issue I'm having is being {{champion:245}}'d by everyone else. My connection is being routed through NTT and being sent all the way to Seattle and then back to Chicago.

Windstream isn't peering with Riot so you won't really get the best routing to their game servers and won't notice that much of an improved ping.

If your going through NTT there was an issue earlier where it was still routing traffic through the seattle location.

I would retest in a few minutes and check if the issue's been resolved.

I drew a diagram to illustrate the problem with Windstream

Edit: Since this is at the top now, I think the problem is that NTT (whom Windstream routes league connections with) has the preference turned up for Spectrumnet (AS 11404, which routes the connection all the way to seattle).  AS 174 (Cogentnet) peers with Riot and would be the better choice for this route, but I have no idea past that on how to make this better :( 

Thanks Napsterbater on the dslreports forum for this information


Edit: Getting 40 ping now, thank you based Rito for pushing for it to be fixed. You're the best!

***UPDATE:***

We have contacted Windstream about peering requests, but have not heard back from them.  If you would like to contact them and ask them to peer with us, it may help in resolving these issues!

---------------------------------------------------------

Given that Windstream is not currently peered with us, I strongly recommend that anyone who has Windstream complete these steps:

1) Make sure to fill out the form in the Log Gathering Tool so we can get any necessary information

2) Contact them directly and ask them to peer with us!
Thanks for the reply. I'm currently talking to one of their agents. I don't know what they can do right now, if anything.

This is great news. The guy was talking to said he would send it up  the ranks.

 http://www.riotgames.com/peering-policy

He said that was the link he was looking at. I really hope something comes out of this.
Thanks a bunch, really cool to see attention confirmed to Windstream. Will be completing the log tool!

Same.

Eastern Kentucky, Winstream

Old: 90
New: 90

It moved over 1800 miles closer and we get no change at all? I don't get it.

Location: Kentucky
ISP: Windstream

same exact problem

Location: Los Angeles California
ISP: Charter

Old Ping: 35-45
New Ping: 75-100

Gotta say this sucks a lot

> [{quoted}](name=Bakura316,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=PZclbVoE,comment-id=0118,timestamp=2015-08-25T20:47:46.551+0000)
>

Basically riot transferred the problem from East to West.

Location Mountain View California 
ISP: Comcast 

Old Ping 31-36
New Ping 63-270

I have to agree that the game freezing for up to two seconds at a time is extremely frustrating.

Just a quick question, many of us here in the Caribbean (I'm from Trinidad and Tobago myself) used to play on NA servers but transferred over to LAN for the lower ping.
Do we get free transfers as well? Can't afford the RP to transfer atm =(

Idk why I posted on my EUW acc, but my LAN acc has the same summoner name.
Only players with US/Canadian IP addresses playing in other Riot regions will have a free transfer token applied to their accounts.  Because of this, your account does not appear to qualify :(
Is there any way I could pay for this fello summoners server swap?
:o that'd be amazing! Latoneyde is my name on LAN servers! Can't wait to play ranked on NA with some fellow English speakers :p
I will do so as soon as I get home from work at 3pm EST. anything to help out a fellow summoner :)
I would recommend sending him a friend request!  And if he accepts, you can always send him a gift of RP!  You won't be able to pay for a Server Move specifically though.

Hi,
For Bell Canada it says in the list that you guys ran into a problem. Can we have more details and an ETA of when it will be fixed?

Thanks,

59ms to 93ms in Winnipeg, Manitoba

I used to play on a stable 110 ping with MTS as my ISP before i changed to Shaw which then gave me a stable 59 ping all game pre migration of the servers. I just logged in today and expected a lowered ping since the servers would move closer as to where i live. I was just shocked to see a stable 93 ping since i was expecting a lower ping of like 40ms post mirgration. Is this because of my ISP or is that the way that it should be after the relocation of the servers?
Hi there! We've checked into this and found some areas to improve routing but need Shaw's help. We have reached out to Shaw in hopes that we can get better routing to help you guys.

Same thing here, I had 56 ping now im at a 93 Ping with shaw, I was also expecting a lower ping because the servers are closer than to portland yet, Im getting 40+ higher ping than usual when the distance has changed?
Make sure to use the Log Gathering Tool and provide us your information!  We want to collect as much as this info as possible so we can investigate, and make any necessary tweaks on our end!

location california, southern california.
isp: time warner

old ping: 30-50
new ping: 160+

thanks riot!

Hey all,

We’re constantly working with ISPs to ensure that you have the most optimized path possible to our game servers through peering.  Even though we have peering agreements with ISPs, there can be issues where the ISP doesn’t enable peering on their end or the peering becomes inefficient.  A relevant example is Shaw, whom we’ll focus on for this post.  

Currently, we peer with Shaw in Seattle, which routes all Shaw traffic there first before going on Riot’s dedicated network - even if that isn’t the shortest path possible. We’ve heard from a lot of players in Alberta who are being directed to Seattle and then being directed to Chicago. Check out the image below:

http://i.imgur.com/5YHRVXl.jpg

We contact all peered ISPs (including Shaw) in an attempt to ensure that they’re correctly routing to Chicago before the move. However, it can sometimes take time for ISPs to respond back to us (anywhere from 20 minutes to days or even weeks).

In the case of Shaw, players were actually having a more negative experience on our peering network than they would on public internet. In situations such as this, we will consider disabling peering with that ISP if we determine this will improve the experience for players on that ISP overall. We will continue reaching out to these ISPs to hopefully enable peering again. 

***Fortunately, Shaw has responded to us and are actively working with us to resolve any peering/routing issues.***  If all goes according to plan, this should be resolved shortly, and should look like this:

http://i.imgur.com/xYoDxur.jpg

If we experience a similar issue with another ISP, and have to remove our peering with them, here is what all of you can do to help us get a resolution ASAP.

Call your ISP or send them a support ticket and let them know the following:

* You are having a poor experience playing League (Riot Games) from your geographic location.

* Make sure to attach the file created from the [Log Gathering Tool](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs) that shows your routing

* Ask them to peer with us, and provide our [peering policy](http://www.riotgames.com/peering-policy) (this is especially crucial for smaller ISPs who may not have heard of Riot Games/League of Legends)

We’re also contacting ISPs on a constant basis, so this will help us get the attention of ISPs from both ends.

Alaska has a ping of 160+, its not even a understatement when I say you can not play at this ping. Is there anything going to be done for this. Is there another server that would give me a better ping. I used to be at 65 on average
With ACS or GCI?  Anchorage or out of town?  I got hit hard 42-104 but 160?  Shiiiit.
im in Fairbanks with gci, best internet they provide, and was at 65 before now 160, kiting with adc is impossible

Chandler, AZ. Went from 50/60ms to 110ms. I am on Cox ISP. Kinda sucks to have double the ping. I see you mentioned working on peering with Cox for more efficient route hops, but is this actually going to happen or is it soon (tm)? Either way I have no incentive to play the game with 110ms. East coast players are amazed at their 25-40ms latency while everyone in the west gets double ping. 70ms would be fine, but 110-120? I've never heard of a massively popular game with a nation wide player base just tell the players to deal with high ping 

In Word of Warcraft  you can actually queue with people on other servers in PvP modes and end up on a server that averages out the latency amongst the players. Couldn't you use some of that Tencent  money to invest in a smarter server infrastructure?

Hi, 
Almost all of Saskatchewan, for whatever reason, has received double the ping since the server move. I have submitted a ticket, but I'm unsure as to why this is happening (I am with Sasktel, a friend in Saskatoon is with Shaw)

Any idea when this is going to be fixed? Or if it can be fixed?

EDIT: It appears I may be having the same issue as people from Shaw in Calgary, Winnipeg and Saskatoon.  We are all being routed to the Portland servers and back to Chicago. How can we help you guys fix this?
Would be nice to get a response to this.  We are all in the same boat. are we just screwed? or what?

I'm currently living in Mexico, I live on the border to be exact. I used to have 60-80 ping and now it's up to 187-192. I think probably all Mexico is having the same issue or its even worse. Are you guys going to make it free to transfer our acounts to NA servers? I spend a lot of RP in this account to start all over again.

Any work being done with the Charter routing from DFW Texas? 

Traceroutes are showing jumps all over Illinois and Missouri before landing in Chicago which seems to be inflating the latency by 35~ ms. 

Submitted a ticket already, just wondering if I can expect it to get better or if I'm stuck with the same 85 ping I had before.
Same issue. I've been talking to charter but they refuse that it's their issue. DFW charter.

I'm having the same issue.
ISP is charter as well.

tracert to 104.160.131.1 gives me 41. ping but I get 85 ping in customs (the same as it was before). 
But I haven't had time to play a matchmade yet.

Location: Anchorage, AK
ISP: GCI
Connection 100Mbps/5Mbps

Old Ping: 55-60
New Ping: 105-110

Log file submitted, hopefully it helps get this resolved.

Need a dedicated NW server for the Pacific Northwest/West Coast and a dedicated East Coast server = problem solved.

hello 
Location: topeka,ks
ISP: Cox communications
Old ping: 90-100
New ping:84-120

i know my isp is not peer 
my ping keep's 120 ping  and then after 4 min or so it goes down to 85+ and up again 
is that normal?

Went from 35ms to 85ms, from Orange County, CA (Cox Gigablast)

It's nice that it seems like everybody else around the country got lower ping, but... :(

"Live" Clinic? All you guys have said is fill in your Log Gathering Tool. No fixes, and no replies to some of us that know what the problem is, have known for 2 weeks, have sent you what the problems are and have not heard anything back.

You guys have not responded to ANY Canadian threads. I've seen RiotAhab respond on Twitter to someone asking about allergies in regards to the servers, but not a single one to people who have actual problems. Either please respond or honestly I will probably be quitting this game. I'm not playing a game where the developer has no interest in helping fix problems that are easy to fix, and also lieing to us saying "SK will stay the same with the move", and instead the ping doubling.

The fact that this server move has caused this many issues shows that you should have put maybe a bit more time into researching what these ISP's would do, rather than having one test day, and moving it 2 weeks later. Its rather frustrating seeing so many people complain when you guys could have a) fixed these issues and left the servers in status quo until almost all issues were resolved, or b) MAKE 2 SERVERS. NA Community? Give us east and west coast servers. I'd rather have all of NA play on <60 ping that have all play near or around 40-80 than have the ability to play with someone in New York or Florida.

Honestly everyone who had their ping affected in a majorly negative way should just stop playing for awhile. Keep posting in the forums though, they can't ignore that forever. Bad publicity. Deserve the bad publicity though Riot, everyone knew what was gonna happen with this server move but you guys just keep ignoring us. That's just rude riot, we respect you enough to put money into your company, respect us enough to give us real answers please. You can say "we screwed west coast players and hawaii and alaska because theres more money in the east". You can be jerks if you want but at least be honest about it. I'm definitely not playing this game or putting any money into it until this is addressed.

Dear Rito,
Please undo the Shaw changes as they have increased my ping by 20, from 60 post server move to 80.
Why not just two servers?

Hi! Just hopped into a custom game, I live in NJ and now have 30 ping down from 80, so that's absolutely amazing and I thank you sincerely for that :D. However, I have Verizon and started experiencing packet loss since yesterday, and still am experiencing it today. According to reddit it's a widespread issue. Are you guys aware of this and if so, is it going to be resolved anytime soon?
The changes to Shaw done today made my ping increase by about 26 (from 60 to around 86). I have searched on Reddit and have conversed with friends who have also said their ping has increased.
The Shaw changes resulted in an increase of ~25 ping, from 60 to ~85. I am in Vancouver, British Columbia.

ISP: Verizon

New ping: 60-350

I had 200-300 ping for a solid twenty minutes. Last hitting was impossible. {{item:3070}} {{champion:32}} {{item:3070}}

I KNOW it should be better than this. In contrast I am over 2200 miles from Oregon. What is the issue?

Edit: I just read the log, I'm having the same issue someone else is having in this thread. I'm being routed all the way out to Seattle and back to Chicago.

I have cox, i went from 50 constant ping, but Tuesday since the transfer is 100+ ping constant...it feels like 1k ping. I'm in Arizona paying for a 50mbs download connection, which i get 60mbs constantly on speedtest.net with 10 ping.  My connection is fine, but now i don't want to play league anymore...not until this gets fixed. I'm also hard wired...fix it pls

Old league ping: 56ms tops

New league ping: 100-120ms
